heaviest_rainfall.status: 47.89mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 09 November 2025, marking an exceptional 144.8 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 34.3mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 02 February 2026 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 3 cold snaps; typically, 3.6 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 0 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (203°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: 128.2 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 27 January 2026.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.1°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and near calm conditions. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and light levels will be low during the day. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
